file_content.text: T6-D4 = patching you through // Supreme Commander Jace Malcom = standing by!
That was impressive soldiering you did on Makeb. Lot of former slaves would like to shake your hand right now. Lot of former mercenaries are wishing they'd never met you.
It's a big planet. I doubt we found every mercenary outpost and refugee zone.
We didn't get everyone.
Agreed, which is why my scouts won't stop looking until they've ID'd them all.
Do we know what stopped Makeb from tearing itself apart?
Did we solve Makeb's mystery?
The big brains will be analyzing the data for months. A shame we haven't got that much time.
Did we figure out why Imperial forces are sniffing around?
What about the Empire?
I think they're still after Isotope-5. One more reason we won't be leaving anytime soon.
Now the bad news... sensors detect toxic gas from the core filling Makeb's atmosphere. We're projecting the planet's air will be unbreathable in weeks.
We can forget about resettling Makeb--but there's still plenty of work to do down there. Hope you'll stick around and lend a hand.
I look forward to serving with you again. Supreme Commander Malcom out.
You + Supreme Commander Jace Malcom = T6 favorite heroes!
Your team = Heroes of Makeb + greatest Republic warriors // T6 = not worthy of this interaction!
You = Hero of Makeb + great Republic champion // T6 = not worthy of this interaction!
Priority incoming transmission = Supreme Commander Jace Malcom // You = stand by?
Lucky I caught you bunch, before the Propaganda Office commandeers you for every morning news holovid from Coruscant to Hoth.
Master Jedi... I've never paid my proper respects for all the beat-downs you've handed the enemy. Hoping you can spare a few more.
Master Jedi... I'm told you're the Order's expert on unexplained mysteries. Got a doozy for you. Hoping you can solve it quick.
Major... I need you to form up Havoc Squad, pack all the ammo your troops can carry and prep for immediate transport.
Captain... I'm sure you'd like to get back to whatever it is you do for a living, but the Republic still needs your service.
Glad I caught you before the holovid chat circuit did. We might want to hold off giving interviews about our latest operation.
Something's happened on Makeb. More accurately, it didn't happen. Scout teams report the planet has stabilized. The groundquakes and volcanic eruptions have all subsided.
The Science Office big brains can't explain it. All we know is, Makeb isn't tearing itself apart anymore.
We wouldn't be talking if you were calling with good news. There's a problem.
There's still trouble, though.
Lots of problems, actually.
Perhaps we won't need to find Makeb's people a new homeworld, after all.
That's good news for refugees.
I think that's what Madame Chancellor is hoping, but the planet's already being resettled.
All due respect, Supreme Commander, but what are you expecting Havoc Squad to do? Point blasters at Makeb until it starts talking?
So send a science team.
Answers aren't the only things I need. You'll have plenty to keep you busy.
You would not believe all the valuables I was forced to leave behind just in Toborro's Palace alone. I'm gonna need a bigger ship....
Great! I can loot the place.
I'm not calling you for a salvage run.
The ark barely escaped before that mesa blew sky-high.
But we saw it exploding.
Turns out that was an isolated incident. Good thing, too.
All that means is, it's probably waiting to blow up when we least expect it. I'm not risking my life there again.
I'm not going back there.
What if I told you there were people still alive on Makeb?
When the Hutts swallowed that treaty you forced down their throats, they abandoned their mercs planetside.
The mercs are making the most of having survived. They've taken over Makeb and enslaved thousands of civilian refugees who we thought were dead.
Those people were counting on us to get them to safety. We have to finish what we started.
We can't leave them behind.
I thought you might take a personal interest.
Even if we free the slaves, we have no way to get them off the planet.
How do we evacuate them?
I thought the impossible was your specialty. Don't worry, there's a plan.
Typical mercenaries. The moment they're unemployed, they turn into exactly the kind of people they're hired to shoot.
That filthy merc scum!
I'm sure the irony isn't lost on their victims. It's time we put these akk dogs down permanently.
One more thing... scouts report Imperial forces are on Makeb. That's why I'm commanding this mission personally. I want answers.
We've sliced the planet's comm network. When you land on Makeb, I'll keep in touch. Head to the coordinates I'm transmitting for further orders.
T6-D4 = big fan // You = hero!
